metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Blurg in the Lodge.Blurg is present there in case the gith massacre hasn't happened and players have met it in UND.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - LOW Lodge → Blurg is present- Talk to Blurg at -203; 24; -80

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *There is nothing left to speak of. His friend is gone, his focus now diverted to the nurturing  of Omeluum's legacy - his work.*

13.speaker: Blurg
13.text: You again. I hope you left your violent impulses back in the Underdark. They have no place in the Society of Brilliance.

15.speaker: Blurg
15.text: Omeluum tells me I have you to thank for its safe return.

52.speaker: Blurg
52.text: We know the risks when we go out into the field, but to lose my friend in such a way would have been most disheartening.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Bravery is no bad thing. In fact, your research could be invaluable for my cause.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: You should stick to reading books. It's much safer.

82.speaker: Blurg
82.text: I know a wizard over in Elturel who'd disagree. Incurable paper cuts are no laughing matter.

29.speaker: Blurg
29.text: If there's any conclusion to be drawn from this, I think it's that Omeluum and I are safest back in the Underdark.

36.speaker: Blurg
36.text: Our research there must continue. We may not be able to fight on the front lines as you do, but we may yet do some good for those who call it home.

21.speaker: Blurg
21.text: We'll depart when this Absolute army is defeated. I understand you are involved in the matter.

40.speaker: Blurg
40.text: We will not let you leave empty-handed, though. Make sure you speak to Omeluum before you leave.

7.speaker: Blurg
7.text: Of course. And for a friend such as yourself, I'm happy to apply our full academic discount.

88.speaker: Blurg
88.text: Of course. And given the aid you provided to Omeluum, I'm happy to offer you Society member rates.

77.speaker: Blurg
77.text: I hope our gifts will provide you with some meaningful assistance in fighting the evil Omeluum uncovered. Do let us know how you get on.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I usual tell people to keep to the city - but in your case, perhaps the wilds are safer.

16.speaker: Blurg
16.text: Is there something I can do for you?

25.speaker: Blurg
25.text: Is there anything I can do for you, friend?

28.speaker: Blurg
28.text: My surface-dwelling friend. I take it you were curious to see the Society of Brilliance for yourself?

39.speaker: Blurg
39.text: The lure of knowledge is a hard one to resist. Even where it requires us to endure discomfort.

2.speaker: Blurg
2.text: For example, it is quite bright up here. I had forgotten about the malady known as 'sunburn'.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I hear there's an unguent that protects against the sun's powers...

9.speaker: Blurg
9.text: A field of research I am glad exists - it will be of immense value for those exposed to it on a more regular basis.

63.speaker: Blurg
63.text: As for me - I'll remain indoors. The Society's library will keep me quite busy until I return to my research in the Underdark.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Why did you leave the Underdark?

24.speaker: Blurg
24.text: We are required to attend the Lodge from time to time, in order to present our findings to the Society's members.

69.speaker: Blurg
69.text: My research partner prefers to avoid crowds, and so has remained in the Underdark to monitor our zurkhwood samples.

76.speaker: Blurg
76.text: I am eager to return myself, but I must prepare my treatise before I depart. Sharing knowledge is one of the Society's most important tenets.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: What's the subject of your treatise?

80.speaker: Blurg
80.text: 'The Underused Underdark: Applications for Zurkhwood in Unlocking the Future of Subterranean Civilisations.'

48.speaker: Blurg
48.text: I may be indulging myself somewhat with its title, but I do believe our research harbours such potential. I only hope the Society's members agree.

79.speaker: Blurg
79.text: Speaking of which, I should get back to annotating my references. Is there anything else I can do for you?

32.speaker: Blurg
32.text: Of course. I always carry samples, in case there are inquiring minds looking to purchase them.

51.speaker: Blurg
51.text: Then I wish you a pleasant day. May it bring you a wealth of discoveries.

38.speaker: Blurg
38.text: It seems your aggression has its uses after all. Omeluum tells me I've you to thank for its safe return.

43.speaker: Blurg
43.text: My surface-dwelling friend. How long has it been?

12.speaker: Blurg
12.text: I am glad to see you well. I see your tadpole remains in its state of suspension.

74.speaker: Blurg
74.text: Your case has set us on quite the detour from our planned expedition work. We've thought about very little else.

3.speaker: Blurg
3.text: In the field, seeking further subjects for study. Though it has been gone for longer than I anticipated.

53.speaker: Blurg
53.text: After observing the nature of your tadpole's stasis, we felt it wise to report back to the Society.

65.speaker: Blurg
65.text: Omeluum went out into the city to seek out further undeveloped infections like yours, but I have heard nothing since.

55.speaker: Blurg
55.text: I admit, I'm somewhat concerned. We are usually sticklers for updating one another on our progress.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I have bad news. Your friend the mind flayer, Omeluum, is dead.
89.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound calm, but very worried

84.speaker: Blurg
84.text: Poor Omeluum. This is terrible news. Our research is meant for good - it should not get us killed.

90.speaker: Blurg
90.text: Omeluum would want me to continue its work, and I have a rudimentary understanding of its hypothesis.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I'll track Omeluum down. Where was it headed?
20.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound calm, but very worried

6.speaker: Blurg
6.text: Omeluum believed the answer to this riddle lay within the city walls, and held some connection to the cult of the Absolute.
6.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound calm, but very worried

46.speaker: Blurg
46.text: I had the distinct impression it was intentionally keeping its hypothesis from me. As though even the theory would be enough to put me in danger.
46.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound calm, but very worried

86.speaker: Blurg
86.text: Why that would be, I can only theorise myself. It is rather outside my area of expertise.
86.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound calm, but very worried

4.speaker: Blurg
4.text: Omeluum is most likely safe and well, and simply absorbed in its work. However, it would put my mind at rest to confirm it, if you happen across its path.
4.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound calm, but very worried

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Perhaps Omeluum prefers to work alone, given its connection to the subject matter.

44.speaker: Blurg
44.text: A fair assumption. Omeluum is not given to strong emotion, but I know it regrets the damage caused by others of its kind.

34.speaker: Blurg
34.text: I am doing my best to conduct my own research in its absence.

37.speaker: Blurg
37.text: Unfortunately my second-hand knowledge does not compare to the innate understanding Omeluum brings to such study.

14.speaker: Blurg
14.text: Naturally. The Underdark provided us with some most unusual salvage. Plenty to keep an inquiring mind busy.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Now is not the time for concern - now is a time for action. Go out and find your friend!

30.speaker: Blurg
30.text: To jump to action without evidence is hardly becoming of the Society of Brilliance.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I'll head out now - see if I can pick up Omeluum's trail.

5.speaker: Blurg
5.text: Of course. I should get back to my research.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I thought you were conducting research in the Underdark?

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I've become quite the expert on my tadpole since we last met.

83.speaker: Blurg
83.text: You have? I would love to hear your conclusions, but it would not feel right to do so without my research partner.

54.speaker: Blurg
54.text: Your tadpole's stasis is a most curious area of study. I will have much to share with Omeluum upon its return.
54.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with the player, but moving on from your conflict

64.speaker: Blurg
64.text: We meet again. This time without the need for violence, I hope.
64.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with the player, but moving on from your conflict

70.speaker: Blurg
70.text: I see you have not yet undergone ceremorphosis. I can only assume your tadpole remains in stasis.
